solution.text:
Let us draw a diagram as per the data given in the problem
Now AB is the chord of a circle, AB=_{{trunc(j*Decimal('1.732'),2)}}_
We know, OC is the perpendicular bisector on AB, so \(CB=\frac {AB}2 =_{{j*Decimal('1.732')/2}}_\)
Now in right angle triangle OCB we have OB=r
\(sin\frac {\theta}2=\frac {CB}r\Rightarrow r=\frac{_{{j*Decimal('1.732')/2}}_}{sin\frac {\theta}2}\)
Now from the arc length ADB we can calculate the radius
arc length=\(2\times \pi \times r\times \frac {\theta}{360}\)=_{{trunc(2*pi_val*j/3,2)}}_
\(\Rightarrow r=\frac{_{{j*Decimal('1.732')/2}}_}{sin\frac {\theta}2}\), we get
\(\Rightarrow 2\times \pi \times \frac{_{{j*Decimal('1.732')/2}}_}{sin\frac {\theta}2}\times\frac {\theta}{360}\)=_{{trunc(2*pi_val*j/3,2)}}_
by putting \(\theta \) values from the options we get, \(\theta=120^\circ\)

content.text:
Length of the chord of a circle is _{{trunc(j*Decimal('1.732'),2)}}_ and length of the corresponding arc is _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j/3,2)}}_
Choose the angle subtended by the arc at the centre
